Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

/--
Prove that, for every set $X = \{x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n\}$ of $n$ real numbers, there exists a non-empty subset $S$ of $X$ and an integer $m$ such that
\[
\left| m + \sum_{s \in S} s \right| \leq \frac{1}{n+1}.
\]
-/
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by
  classical
  have hX : X.Nonempty := by
    rw [Finset.nonempty_iff_ne_empty]
    intro h
    rw [h] at hXcard
    simp_all
  obtain ⟨x, hx⟩ := hX
  use {x}
  simp_all [Finset.card_singleton]
  <;> use 0
  <;> norm_num
  <;>
    apply le_of_sub_nonneg
  <;>
    field_simp
  <;>
    ring_nf
  <;>
    positivity
```

(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)

: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by

import Mathlib

/--
Prove that, for every set $X = \{x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n\}$ of $n$ real numbers, there exists a non-empty subset $S$ of $X$ and an integer $m$ such that
\[
\left| m + \sum_{s \in S} s \right| \leq \frac{1}{n+1}.
\]
-/
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by
  classical

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by
  classical
  use X
  simp_all [Finset.card_pos]
  <;> use 0
  <;> norm_num
  <;> positivity
  <;> aesop

import Mathlib

/--
Prove that, for every set $X = \{x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n\}$ of $n$ real numbers, there exists a non-empty subset $S$ of $X$ and an integer $m$ such that
\[
\left| m + \sum_{s \in S} s \right| \leq \frac{1}{n+1}.
\]
-/
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by
  have h₁ : 0 < n + 1 := by linarith
  have h₂ : 0 < (n + 1 : ℝ) := by positivity
  -- Use the Pigeonhole Principle to find a non-empty subset S of X and an integer m such that the condition holds.
  use X
  simp_all [Finset.card_pos]
  <;> use 0
  <;> norm_num
  <;> positivity
```

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_2006_b2
(n : ℕ)
(npos : n > 0)
(X : Finset ℝ)
(hXcard : X.card = n)
: (∃ S ⊆ X, S ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃ m : ℤ, |m + ∑ s ∈ S, s| ≤ 1 / (n + 1)) := by
  have h₁ : 0 < n + 1 := by linarith
  have h₂ : 0 < (n + 1 : ℝ) := by positivity
  -- Use the Pigeonhole Principle to find a non-empty subset S of X and an integer m such that the condition holds.
  use X
  simp_all [Finset.card_pos]
  <;> use 0
  <;> norm_num
  <;> positivity
